benchmark_details.name: QUITE (Quantifying Uncertainty in Natural Language Text)
benchmark_details.overview: QUITE is a question answering dataset of real-world Bayesian reasoning scenarios with categorical random variables and complex relationships, providing verbalizations of premises and evidence statements, expecting numeric probability estimates as answers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess uncertainty-based reasoning capabilities in natural language processing through Bayesian reasoning scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The assumptions involve that the entire probability distribution is known, which may not hold in real-world scenarios where distributions are often underspecified.

data.source: Publicly available Bayesian networks compiled from literature.
data.annotation: Semi-automatically generated with LLM assistance and manual verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on numeric estimates and comparing model outputs to ground truth probabilities.
methodology.interpretation: An accuracy percentage indicating how many instances were correctly solved by the models.
methodology.validation: Instances manually validated for correctness and linguistic quality.
